intro: Actinomeris pedunculosa, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, flowering stems that bear clusters of small, white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive veining pattern. Actinomeris pedunculosa thrives in harsh, cold environments and is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils.
